intro: Riedlea elongata, commonly known as the longleaf riedlea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Riedlea elongata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
